input_text:
Job Title: Senior Product Marketing Manager - Consent & UCPM

Location: Atlanta, GA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Marketing, Sales

Description:
Strength in Trust

OneTrust is the trust intelligence cloud platform organizations use to transform trust from an abstract concept into a measurable competitive advantage. Organizations globally use OneTrust to enable the responsible use of data while protecting the privacy rights of individuals, implement and report on their cyber security program, make their social impact goals a reality, and create a speak up culture of trust. Over 14,000 customers use OneTrust's technology, including half of the Global 2,000. OneTrust currently ranks #24 on the Forbes Cloud 100 list of top private cloud companies in the world and employs over 2,000 people in regions across North America, South America, Asia, Europe, and Australia.

The Challenge

We are seeking an experienced Senior Technical Product Marketing Manager with a focus on privacy management to join our dynamic team on the Privacy & Data Governance cloud. As the Senior Technical Product Marketing Manager, you will play a pivotal role in shaping and executing the go-to-market strategy of our core privacy line of business.

This role requires technical product marketing expertise, a deep understanding of buyer personas, messaging frameworks, and privacy regulations. You will work closely with cross-functional teams including product management, sales, customers and our broader marketing team. You will leverage both technical and storytelling skills to create messaging, drive content, and launch products to build pipeline and ensure customer success and product adoption.

Your Mission

Develop core bill of materials for our privacy management solutions within the Privacy & Data Governance cloud. Collaborate with Product Management to define and build customer facing roadmaps, launch new products, and release feature updates and enhancements. Conduct market research and customer interviews to understand privacy-related pain points and user needs, translating them into market requirements and messaging. Collaborate with Global Demand Generation to create targeted campaigns and content that educates customers about our solutions and drives revenue. Lead the creation of sales enablement materials to empower our sales teams with the knowledge and tools needed to effectively sell the benefits of our products. Stay up to date with industry trends and emerging technologies, positioning our company as a thought leader in the space. Develop and own the go to market strategy for our core Privacy Management line of business within the Privacy & Data Governance Cloud. Be the voice of the customer, understand your target persona, their unique pain points and how our solutions can help them, by partnering with sales and attending customer calls. Monitor global privacy regulations and industry best practices, providing insights and recommendations to ensure competitive positioning. Partner closely with the OneTrust Centers of Excellence to ensure we deliver on our commitment to customers of same-day regulatory response. Define the messaging & positioning for OneTrust’s products and solutions to communicate core value propositions and how our tools help customers solve problems. Develop internal content and assets, presentations, training, competitive analysis, and other collateral to enable the sales team. Develop external content like videos, data sheets, webinars, and other assets that resonate with OneTrust’s global customer base. Work with solutions engineering teams to develop and maintain product demos. Work with product management to understand and define product requirements and roadmap. Partner with demand generation to define and execute timely campaigns based on market events and business priorities to build awareness and pipeline. Own the coordination and execution of product launches for new products, solutions, features, and positioning. Engage with customers to gain insights and feedback through different channels such as demos, QBRs, and customer advisory boards. Present at both OneTrust-hosted and industry events and in customer calls and demonstrations 

You Are

Experience simplifying complex technical concepts into clear, digestible content for less technical audiences. Ability to understand how technology solves market problems and can translate solution value into a clear message. Experience in developing robust and compelling messaging guides. Experience owning and defining go-to-market plans for multiple products or solutions. Ability to use data and analytics to drive decision making and experience defining and delivering against measurable marketing metrics. Proven track record of successful product launches and enabling a direct sales team Ability to manage multiple products and cross-functional initiatives. Excellent communication, presentation, writing, editing, and project management skills. Passion for working in a lean, fast-paced organization and ability to work under tight deadlines. Proven track record of speaking in front of and influencing internal, external, and global audiences. BA/BS degree in marketing, business, or engineering equivalent 7+ years of product marketing or product management experience at a SaaS or other high-tech company Experience partnering closely with product teams to define roadmaps and bring features to market. Confident leader with the ability to define and execute go to market initiatives with minimal guidance among multiple goals and priorities. Experience in the data privacy space. A technical background based on degree (i.e. engineering or computer science) or experience applying complex technical concepts in practice Technical product experience like sales engineering or implementation Proven, hands-on experience developing a variety of collateral including pitch decks, demos, data sheets, videos, and webinar/event content. Worked at a privacy, security, compliance, or data governance software company previously in similar capacity Pragmatic or Product Marketing Alliance certification IAPP certification (CIPP/M CIPP/E)

For California, Colorado, Connecticut, Nevada, New York, Rhode Island, and Washington-based candidates: the annual base pay range for this role is listed below. Within this range, individual pay is determined by several factors, including location, job-related skills, work experience, and relevant education and/or training. This role may also be eligible for discretionary bonuses, equity, and/or commissions, as well as benefits.

Salary Range

$146,250—$219,375 USD

Where we Work

OneTrust embraces a hybrid working model. Our Working@ OneTrust initiative is our way of clarifying where we hire, how we work together, and where we’re located in that hybrid model.

The underlying “why” for Working@ is that we are intentional about the culture that we want to create together. That includes bringing teams together, in-person, throughout the year to collaborate, build connections, learn from each other, and celebrate our wins to Finish Stronger.

We are committed to a flexible approach informed by a set of guiding principles. You’ll see that reflected in our worker designations: “Office-flex” and “Location-flex”.

Office-flex: Like a traditional hybrid model, OneTrust “Office-flex” employees may be asked to work in an office periodically if they are within a commutable distance to a OneTrust office. This includes coming into the office for our Company Kickoff, Company All Hands, and other larger company events. Beyond that, we give our leaders and teams the flexibility to set additional guidelines based on the nature of your role. Location-flex: Similar to other companies’ remote policies, for OneTrust “Location-flex" roles, you will primarily work from your home office location. However, you may be required to travel to our OneTrust offices or customer sites periodically based on the nature of your role.

Each role may have specific requirements, so we encourage you to verify the location of the role with your recruiter during your first interview.

Benefits

As an employee at OneTrust, you will be part of the OneTeam. That means you’ll receive support physically, mentally, and emotionally so that you can do your best work both in and out of the office. This includes comprehensive healthcare coverage, flexible PTO, equity stock options, annual performance bonus opportunities, retirement account support, 14+ weeks of paid parental leave, career development opportunities, company-paid privacy certification exam fees, and much more. Specific benefits differ by country. For more information, talk to your recruiter or visit onetrust.com/careers.

Resources

Check out the following to learn more about OneTrust and its people:

OneTrust Careers on YouTube@LifeatOneTrust on Instagram

Your Data

You have the right to have your personal data updated or removed. You also have the right to have a copy of the information OneTrust holds about you. Further details about these rights are available on the website in our Privacy Overview. You can change your mind at any time and have your personal data removed from our database. In order to do this you must contact us and let us know you wish to be removed. The request should be made on the Data Subject Request Form.

Our Commitment to You

When you join OneTrust you are stepping onto a launching pad — the countdown has begun. The destination? A career without boundaries working alongside a diverse and inclusive crew who is passionate about doing meaningful work. As a pioneer, your voice and expertise will help chart the direction of an entirely new industry — Trust. Our commitment to putting people first starts with you. Your growth is part of the mission. Our goal is to give you the power to embark on the next phase of your uniquely, unique career

OneTrust provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by local laws.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
